name: Integrate Make into Your KSAT Console
title: Integrate Make into Your KSAT Console
body:
You can integrate your Make platform into your KSAT console. Make allows you to visually design and deploy event-driven, real-time automations that respond instantly to user actions, such as failed phishing tests or course completions. Make utilizes KnowBe4’s Graph APIs to enable automated security awareness training workflows and data management in areas including groups, users, phishing, and training.

Before You Connect Make to Your KSAT Console

Before integrating Make into your KSAT console, you must find your API address and create a Product API token. Follow the steps below to do both actions.

Note:KnowBe4's Graph APIs are available to Diamond-level customers. For more information about Graph APIs, please see our KnowBe4 Graph API Overview article.
  1. Your API address depends on where your KnowBe4 account is located. Please see the table below to find the API address for your region.
    Region Base URL
    US https://us.api.knowbe4.com
    CA https://ca.api.knowbe4.com
    EU https://eu.api.knowbe4.com
    UK https://uk.api.knowbe4.com
    DE https://de.api.knowbe4.com
  2. Log in to your KSAT console as an admin.
  3. Navigate to Account Settings in the top-right corner under your account’s email address.
  4. In Account Settings, navigate to Account Integrations.
  5. Under Product API, select Product API. The Product API subtab will open.
  6. At the top-right corner of the Product API subtab, select + Create New API Token.
  7. Fill out the fields on the Create New API Token page.
  8. Select Create Token. The Product API Token pop-up window will open.
  9. Select the Product API token to copy the token. Be sure to save your copied API token in a location that you can easily access. After you close this window, you will not be able to view this token again.

Connecting Make to Your KSAT Console

You can connect your Make platform to your KSAT console by following the steps below.

  1. Log in to your Make platform as an admin.
  2. Select your desired organization.

  3. In your chosen organization, select + Create scenario.

  4. In the New scenario section, search for KnowBe4 under All Apps. Select the KnowBe4 app.

  5. Once you select the KnowBe4 app, you should be able to view 37 actions.

  6. Select any of the actions you would like to take.
  7. Select Create a connection.

  8. A pop-up window should allow you to enter the Product API token and API address you received in the previous steps. Once you have established a connection, it can be used for other Make modules.

Setting Up KnowBe4 Workflows in Make

You can set up KSAT workflows in your Make platform by following the steps below.

  1. In your Make organization, navigate to Scenarios > All Apps > KnowBe4. Select an action. In this example, we will select Create a User.

  2. Provide the required user information in the pop-up screen.

  3. Select Save to save the user information.
  4. In the lower-left corner of the page, select Run once.

  5. The user’s information should now be visible in KSAT. In your KSAT console, the user’s email address should be visible by navigating to Users > Manage Users > Users.

  6. If you would like to run multiple modules in Make, you can also connect them and select Run once.

If you experience issues integrating Make with your KSAT console, please contact Make’s technical support.

images.alt:
This image displays the "My Organization" dashboard view within a web application, focused on organization-level usage and configuration.

**Layout and Navigation:**

*   **Left Sidebar (Purple):** Functions as the primary navigation.
    *   The "My Organization" section is expanded, highlighting the currently active tab: **Organization** (with a house icon).
    *   Under "MY TEAM," links include: Team, Scenarios, **AI Agents (BETA)**, Templates, Connections, and More.
    *   The bottom section includes Resource Hub, What's New, and Notifications.
*   **Main Content Area:** Titled **"My Organization"**.

**Main Content Tabs and Controls:**

*   **Horizontal Navigation Tabs:** ORGANIZATION (active), TEAMS, USERS, SUBSCRIPTION, PAYMENTS, INSTALLED APPS, VARIABLES, SCENARIO PROPERTIES.
*   **Top Right Controls:**
    *   A dropdown button labeled **"Organization settings"** (with an edit icon).
    *   A primary button labeled **"+ Create scenario"**.

**Organization Dashboard Metrics:**

Four key metric cards are displayed horizontally near the top:

1.  **Average daily usage:** `14 -56.3%`
2.  **Credits left:** `949 / 1,000` (Shown with a purple progress ring, indicating low usage).
3.  **Usage reset in:** `23 days` (`10/21/25, 12:08 PM`)
4.  **Active scenarios:** `0 / 2` (Includes an **"Upgrade"** button, suggesting a limit based on the current plan).

**Usage Charts:**

*   **Title:** **Usage**
*   **Metrics Tracked:**
    *   **Credits** (Purple line): Shows usage of `~51/1,000 (5% used)`.
    *   **Data transfer** (Teal line): Shows usage of `~173.4 KB/512.0 MB (0% used)`.
*   **Chart Detail:** A multi-line chart plots usage over a period (implied monthly, with days 30, 31, 1., 2., ... up to 28 labeled on the X-axis). A specific date marker for **"September 21, 2025"** is visible on the graph. The Y-axis for credits ranges from 0 to 160, and the right Y-axis for data transfer ranges from 0 to 7.6 MB.

**Active Scenarios Section:**

*   **Title:** **Active scenarios**
*   **Status Text:** "There are no active scenarios in this organization."

images.alt:
This image depicts an organizational dashboard interface focused on usage metrics and management.

**I. Navigation Sidebar (Purple)**

*   **Organization Context:** The sidebar header displays "RAMYA ORGANIZATION" with a dropdown selector.
*   **Active View:** The **Organization** tab (house icon) is currently selected and highlighted.
*   **Primary Menu Items:** The navigation lists core functions under the heading "MY TEAM": Team, Scenarios, **AI Agents (labeled BETA)**, Templates, Connections, and More.

**II. Header and Main Title**

*   **Title:** The main heading identifies the account as "Ramya Organization".
*   **Action Buttons (Top Right):** Two primary actions are available: a dropdown button labeled "Organization settings," and a prominent purple button labeled **+ Create scenario**.

**III. Content Tabs**

*   The content area is organized by functional tabs. The **ORGANIZATION** tab is active.
*   **Available Tabs:** ORGANIZATION, TEAMS, USERS, SUBSCRIPTION, PAYMENTS, INSTALLED APPS, VARIABLES, and SCENARIO PROPERTIES.

**IV. Usage Metrics (KPIs)**

Four distinct metric cards display real-time usage data:

1.  **Average daily usage:** Value **65**, showing a change of **0%**.
2.  **Credits left:** **742 / 1,000** available (visualized with a circular progress indicator).
3.  **Usage reset in:** **2 days** (Specific date/time: 9/30/25, 10:19 AM).
4.  **Active scenarios:** **0 / 2** (Includes an accompanying "Upgrade" button).

**V. Detailed Usage Graph**

*   **Section Title:** Usage.
*   **Progress Indicators:**
    *   **Credits (Purple):** Usage is displayed as **~258/1,000 (26% used)**.
    *   **Data transfer (Teal/Blue):** Usage is displayed as **~42.8 MB/512.0 MB (8% used)**.
*   **Visualization:** A time-series line graph plots Credits and Data transfer over approximately 30 days (labeled 30. through 28.).
*   **Axes:** The Y-axis on the left scales data usage (0 to 160 units). The Y-axis on the right displays Data transfer volume (0 to 42.9 MB). The graph shows peak activity for both metrics centered around days 26 and 27.

This image captures a step within a graphical workflow or scenario configuration interface, specifically the selection of an initial application module.

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Header Control (Top Left):** A rounded rectangular button displays the text "New scenario," flanked by a left-facing arrow icon (back/exit) and a configuration icon (two opposing horizontal arrows).
2.  **Module Insertion Point (Center):** A large, circular UI element, colored deep purple with a lighter purple border, features a central white plus sign (+), indicating the location for adding a new module or trigger.
3.  **App Selection Context Menu (Right):** A white vertical panel, labeled "ALL APPS," extends from the right side of the module insertion point. This menu lists available integration applications.

**Detailed Menu Contents:**

*   **Highlighted Selection:** The application **"KnowBe4"** (associated with a red/orange circular arrow logo) is highlighted by a solid blue rectangular border, indicating user focus or selection intent.
*   **Visible List Items (Below Highlight):**
    *   Flow Control
    *   Google Sheets
    *   Tools
    *   OpenAI (ChatGPT, Whisper, DALL...)
    *   Webhooks
    *   HTTP
*   **Search Functionality (Bottom):** A search bar is located at the bottom of the panel, identifiable by a magnifying glass icon and the placeholder text: "Search apps or modules."
*   **Module Icons:** Colored application icons are displayed next to the application names, with a vertical stack of corresponding secondary icons visible along the far right edge of the panel (partially obscured by the scrollable list).

This image displays a configuration interface for integrating API actions, presented in a structured, modal panel overlaying a workflow visualization element (a large purple circle with a white 'plus' icon on the left).

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Header and Navigation:** The top of the panel features a navigation link labeled **← BACK**.
2.  **Module Selection:** A highlighted selection box contains the text **KnowBe4**, indicating the currently configured security training platform integration.
3.  **Action List Structure:** The main body is a scrollable, categorized list of executable API actions (modules). Each action item includes an orange circular icon with a white counter-clockwise arrow (refresh/execute symbol), a primary action title, and a secondary descriptive text line.
4.  **Categories and Actions:**
    *   **PHISHING CAMPAIGN** (Category Header)
        *   **Get Phishing Campaign Run** (Description: *Find a campaign run by ID*)
        *   **List Phishing Campaign Recipients** (Description: *Find all the campaign recipients in a campaign run*)
        *   **List Template Topics** (Description: *Find all template topics*)
    *   **TRAINING CAMPAIGN** (Category Header)
        *   **Create Training Campaign** (Description: *Creates a training campaign in the current account*)
        *   *(Additional actions are truncated below the fold)*
5.  **Search Functionality:** A search bar is located at the bottom of the pane, featuring a magnifying glass icon and the placeholder text **Search modules**.
6.  **Scrolling:** A thin vertical scroll bar is visible on the right edge of the action list, indicating more items are available.
images.context: trong> app, you should be able to view 37 actions.

images.alt:
This image displays a User Interface (UI) for a scenario-based workflow creation tool. The primary view is a white canvas with peripheral navigation and control elements.

**Key UI Elements:**

*   **Left Navigation Panel (Purple Vertical Bar):** Contains various icons for application navigation, including Home, Users, Share (highlighted), History/Logs, Connections, and more. A toggle button labeled "New scena..." is visible at the top left, followed by a filter icon.
*   **Module/Node (Center):** A large red circular graphic represents a module, labeled **"KnowBe4"** underneath, with the specific operation listed as **"Create a User"**. A small red number "1" is visible near the top right of the circle, indicating a configuration requirement or error count. The module icon features a clockwise arrow and a smaller clock icon overlay.
*   **Configuration Modal (Overlay):** A floating purple and white dialog box titled **"KnowBe4"** overlays the center module.
    *   **Header Controls:** Standard window controls (pin, maximize, help/question mark, close/X) are present in the top right.
    *   **Content:** The modal requires a connection, indicated by the field label **"Connection \*"**.
    *   **Action Button:** A prominent red button labeled **"Create a connection"** is displayed.
    *   **Help Text:** Instructional text below the button reads: "For more information on how to create a connection to KnowBe4, see the **online Help.**" (online Help is a hyperlinked text).
    *   **Footer Buttons:** **"Cancel"** (white button) and **"Save"** (purple button) are available at the bottom right.
*   **Bottom Control Panel:** A horizontal bar at the bottom provides controls for running and managing the workflow.
    *   **Execution Controls:** A purple button labeled **"Run once"** and a toggle switch labeled **"Every 15 minutes"** for scheduling.
    *   **Tool Controls:** Icons for various tools are present, including save, zoom/display options, settings, undo/redo, and module interaction icons (green, purple, yellow circles, plus sign).
    *   **AI Feature:** A purple button group on the far right labeled **"AI BETA"** preceded by a lightbulb icon.

**Context:**

The image captures the moment a user is attempting to configure a **KnowBe4** application module set to **Create a User**. The required **Connection** parameter is missing, triggering the display of the connection creation modal and preventing immediate saving of the module configuration.

The image displays a workflow automation platform interface, characterized by a vertical purple sidebar on the left and a scenario canvas area in the center.

**Key UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Sidebar Navigation:** A purple sidebar contains multiple icons, with the 'Share' (or Connections) icon currently highlighted, indicating the user is focused on integrating services.
2.  **Scenario Footer:** The bottom status bar shows execution controls, including a "Run once" button and an "Every 15 minutes" toggle, confirming the context is a scheduled workflow.
3.  **Foreground Modal (Active Input):** A white modal titled **"Create a connection"** is prominent. It requires three input fields (marked with an asterisk indicating required status):
    *   **Connection name:** Input value is "Valid Key."
    *   **API Key:** Input is masked/encrypted (dots) and includes a toggle/eye icon to reveal the key.
    *   **Region:** A dropdown input currently set to "CA."
    *   A "Map" toggle switch is present but inactive.
    *   The modal is finalized with two action buttons: "Close" and the primary action button, "Save" (purple).

4.  **Background Modal (Processing/Error Context):** A second, partially obscured modal lies behind the active input box, titled partially (ending in "e4"). This modal displays a red status bar with the message **"Creating a connection..."** (suggesting a concurrent or prior connection attempt is in progress or failed). It also provides help text referencing **"KnowBe4"** and linking to "online Help."
images.context: ed a connection, it can be used for other Make modules.

images.alt:
This image depicts a context menu or command palette interface overlaid on a light background.

**UI Structure and Elements:**

1.  **Header:** The top contains a **"BACK"** link with a left arrow icon.
2.  **Context/Scope Indicator:** A red-bordered rectangular field displays the text **"KnowBe4"**, indicating the current platform or environment.
3.  **Command List (Filtered):** A scrollable list of actions is displayed below, categorized by function:
    *   **PHISHING CAMPAIGN** (Category header)
    *   **TRAINING CAMPAIGN** (Category header)
        *   Action Item: **"Create Training Campaign"** with the subtext: *Creates a training campaign in the current account*.
    *   **USER** (Category header)
        *   Action Item: **"Create a User"** with the subtext: *Create a User*. This item is highlighted with a blue rectangular border, suggesting it is selected or in focus.
    *   **GROUP** (Category header)
        *   Action Item: **"Create a group"** with the subtext: *Create a group*.
    *   *Note: Each listed action item features a small orange circular icon with a white curved arrow/refresh symbol.*
4.  **Search Bar:** At the bottom, a search field is present, currently containing the partial input text **"create"**. It includes a magnifying glass icon on the left and a dismissal 'x' icon on the right.

**External Context Element:**

To the left of the command menu, a large floating call-to-action or initiation element is visible: a large purple circular icon containing a white plus sign (**+**), indicating an "Add" or "Create" function, which likely triggered the displayed menu.
images.context: ample, we will select Create a User.

images.alt:
This image depicts a configuration dialog used within an integration environment to perform the "Create a User" operation for the KnowBe4 application.

**Context Panel (Left):**
The left panel identifies the module context: "KnowBe4," with the active process labeled "Create a User." A large red circular icon features a white refresh/sync symbol overlaid by a clock icon, indicating a time-sensitive data transaction. A red notification badge displays the numeral '1' next to the main icon.

**Configuration Dialog (Right):**
The primary component is a modal configuration form titled "KnowBe4" in a purple header bar, which includes standard window controls (options, maximize, help, close).

**Form Elements:**
The form requires the configuration of a connection and user attributes:

1.  **Connection Management (Required):**
    *   Label: **Connection \***
    *   Input: A dropdown menu containing the current selection, "Valid Key" (preceded by a small orange icon).
    *   Action: An **Add** button for creating new connection configurations.
    *   Guidance: A lightbulb icon precedes the explanatory text: "For more information on how to create a connection to KnowBe4, see the **online Help**."

2.  **User Data Fields:**
    *   **Email Address \*** (Required input field)
    *   **First Name \*** (Required input field)
    *   **Last Name \*** (Required input field)
    *   **Job Title** (Optional input field, lacking an asterisk)

All data fields contain blurred placeholder or pre-filled content.

**Action Buttons:**
The bottom of the dialog contains two action buttons:
*   **Cancel** (Standard white button)
*   **Save** (Primary purple button)
images.context: the required user information in the pop-up screen.

images.alt:
This image displays a view of an automated workflow or integration module within a white-background application interface.

**Workflow Identification (Center):**
*   **Iconography:** A large, central graphic consists of an orange circle containing a white clockwise refresh arrow. A smaller clock face icon overlays the main circle, indicating scheduling or time-based execution.
*   **Text:** The workflow is identified as **KnowBe4** with a numerical badge (**1**). The associated description is **Create a User**.

**Execution and Scheduling Controls (Bottom Bar):**
The primary focus, indicated by a red pointer arrow and a purple outline, is the immediate execution control:
*   **Run once Button:** A purple-accented button displaying a play-triangle icon and the text **Run once**. This triggers immediate workflow execution.
*   **Scheduling Toggle:** Adjacent to the run button is a disabled (gray) toggle switch labeled **Every 15 minutes**, indicating that automatic, recurring execution is currently inactive.

**Configuration Toolbar (Bottom Right):**
The toolbar contains a series of configuration and utility icons, including icons for data mapping, transformation, testing/deployment, logging/history, settings (cog), saving/duplicating, and undo/redo functionality. The far right features a cluster of colored module icons (Green Cog, Purple Wrench, Orange Interface icon) and a purple **+** (add) button.
images.context: eft corner of the page, select Run once.

images.alt:
This image displays the **KnowBe4** management console, specifically the **USERS** section, focused on the **Manage Users** screen.

**Navigation and Context:**
The primary navigation bar highlights **USERS**. Below the main title "Manage Users," a secondary tab structure shows **Users (active tab)**, Groups, Import Users, Provisioning, Merge Users, Messages, and Security Roles. A prominent action button, **Add Users**, is located in the top right.

**Filter and Utility Bar:**
Above the data table, the interface includes filtering controls for **Status: Active**, **Type: All**, and **Groups: All**. Utility functions include **Bulk Archive** and **Generate CSV**. A search field labeled "Search by email or name..." is present, along with a configuration gear icon dropdown.

**Data Table Structure:**
The user data is displayed in a sortable table with the following columns:
1. Checkbox (for bulk selection)
2. **User** (The data entry for the first user is censored/highlighted in blue).
3. **PPP** (Phishing Prone Percentage)
4. **Risk**
5. **Groups**
6. **Joined on**
7. **Last Login**
8. **Actions** (represented by a vertical ellipsis context menu).

**Data Content:**
The table currently displays 1 row. The visible data for the single user includes: PPP 0%, Risk 0, and Joined on 09/28/2025. The footer confirms, "Displaying all 1 rows."

The image displays a sequential workflow diagram titled **4\_Training Campaign** in the header. The flow consists of four connected action steps related to the **KnowBe4** application.

**Workflow Sequence (Steps 1-4):**
Each step is represented by a large orange circular node with a white loop/refresh icon and a status badge (`✓1`). The application name and successful operations count are listed below each node:

1.  **Trigger/Step 1:** Overlaid with a clock icon, suggesting a timed trigger. Action: `✓ KnowBe4 [6]`, `Create Training Campaign`.
2.  **Step 2:** Action: `✓ KnowBe4 [21]`, `Edit Training Campaign`.
3.  **Step 3:** Action: `✓ KnowBe4 [9]`, `Add User to Training Campaign`.
4.  **Step 4 (End):** Action: `✓ KnowBe4 [10]`, `Remove User from Training Campaign`.

**Connectors and Utilities:**
Nodes are linked by sequential dotted lines. A wrench icon is positioned on the connection line between each main action step, indicating intermediate settings, filters, or utility operations.

**Bottom Control Bar (Execution and Configuration):**
The footer contains runtime and editing controls:

*   **Execution:** A purple button labeled `▷ Run once`, followed by a toggle switch controlling scheduling frequency, labeled `Every 15 minutes`.
*   **Utility Icons:** A series of icons including Layout, Zoom Percentage, Deploy/Publish, History, Settings, Undo, and Redo functions are present.
*   **Panel Controls (Far Right):** Icons for settings, exit, undo (L1), and adding a new module (`+`).
images.context: connect them and select Run once.
